programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a custom-made car from a 1940s fairground ride, and a client brings in an unusual bicycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A regular customer brings Rick a hand-powered railway cart from the 1800s, which the team strive to turn into a museum exhibit.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Tensions between Jamie and Adam boil over as they try to flip a B-train on a narrow icy road. Elsewhere, a two-car collision throws Ken into action. Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A man who can impale himself without experiencing pain or bleeding, an extremely agile climber and someone whose abdominal muscles can withstand the force of a truck.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The murders of a respected vet, his wife and son, who were viciously gunned down in their home, a crime for which it took police almost 10 years to find the culprit.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: George Percy and Sheldon Nichols strip a Land Rover 90 while Frankie Oatway and Ben Szymanski pin their hopes on a Mitsubishi Pajero. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto tackles the ultimate existential question as he explores what happens when people die and whether or not there is life after death.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team heads to Area 51, the epicentre of UFO conspiracies, to meet former employees of the alleged storage site for alien space craft.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a custom-made car from a 1940s fairground ride, and a client brings in an unusual bicycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A regular customer brings Rick a hand-powered railway cart from the 1800s, which the team strive to turn into a museum exhibit.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon experience the sweet taste of success, Mary looks for love and Jarrod and Brandi return to Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four new bladesmiths compete for a chance to forge a Hunga Munga, a four-edged behemoth of a weapon.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: A look inside the USA's secret services, examining what these forces actually do, asking if they really have their country's best interests at heart.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into whether sightings of triangular ships are UFOs or attributable to military aircraft.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Scholars, archaeologists and religious leaders attempt to get to the bottom of the mysteries and unanswered questions posed by the Bible.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buyers Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy head to El Monte, California, where they tackle the local competition head-on.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: With big money at stake the teams are determined to stay on the water, but doubts are raised when sharks venture perilously close to the boats.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Experts consider the possible effects of an eruption of the volcano in Yellowstone Park in America, which could lead to starvation, epidemics and social chaos.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: An inquiry reveals the shocking truth about why two trains crashed in the Rocky Mountains, and leads to revelations about those who run Canada's freight trains.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon experience the sweet taste of success, Mary looks for love and Jarrod and Brandi return to Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on chihuahuas, cheese and constellations. Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies attempt to concoct interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe and Johnny Vegas and former MP Ed Balls join regular panellist Alan Davies. to answer questions about subjects associated with various parts.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Carol will stop at nothing to get the perfect family photo. In the meantime, Melissa has her own mission, Lewis looks for a new hobby and Gail ends up in a scary situation.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.sub-title: Whitney Houston, We Have a Problem
programme.desc: The group sets off to find Melissa when they find a note she left saying 'Goodbye'. Meanwhile, Gail has her own adventure.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A night-time operation takes place targeting drugs and weapons misuse and officers are called to a petrol station to assist with an irate male who has been refused alcohol.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are first in line to pick an incredible North Carolina collection of weird and wonderful circus and sideshow memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and John think they have found a bargain when the team visits Barking in east London, while two former rivals team up when a vintage vehicle sparks a bidding war.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The gang is on Barry and Darren's home turf in Reading, Berkshire, where the pair are determined not to leave empty-handed. Meanwhile, Dan takes a gamble.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a fellow picker's sheds and barns. The pair also examine the oddities collected by landowner John Atwater Bradley.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A Maine homestead reveals six generations of secrets, and NASCAR driver Ryan Newman proves that when it comes to negotiating, he is just as tough as Danielle.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passenger's seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit, and Blur bassist Alex James is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat battles torrential rains, swollen logs and a mud-mired build site to create a high-end cottage on a Minnesota lake.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Dave has a BMW X5 armed response vehicle build to oversee, and is also tasked with repairing a car damaged during a high-speed chase.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments. Among the celebrity guests are Kevin Bishop, Warwick Davis, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Sara Cox and Brian Blessed.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Richard Osman, Tom Courtenay, Sara Pascoe and Chris Kamara. As usual, all participants will be hoping to deceive one another with plausible lies, such as Richard stating he has never seen Breaking Bad because of his Homes Under the Hammer addiction, Sir Tom claiming he enjoys whiskey on his Christmas morning cornflakes, and Chris explaining that his full name is actually Christmas Kamara. The team also presents a somewhat unusual take on the Nativity.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on chihuahuas, cheese and constellations. Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies attempt to concoct interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie and Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew stumbles upon the mysteriously abandoned SS Trojan, and while the group inspects the ship, Rimmer receives a distress call from his brother. Starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister celebrates Father's Day, while Rimmer and Kryten install a new computer - the beautiful, but lethally logical Pree - that quickly puts the ship in danger. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers are marooned on Earth in AD23 and must find a battery to power up the Returner Remote if they are going to make it home. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The team travels to Montsegur in France to investigate the massacre of hundreds of Cathars in 1244.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel to Nottinghamshire, where residents of Clipstone village near Sherwood Forest believe some impressive ruins in a farmer's field may have played a part in the ancient tales of Robin Hood and Bad King John. The extensive building records and high-quality carvings prove a fine building existed somewhere nearby, but finding out what it looked like and how large it was frustrates the archaeologists.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson adjudicates a debate to decide the team's greatest discovery to date. With more than 250 digs to consider, many of which retrieved rare and valuable finds in addition to the ones that revealed intriguing archaeological fakery, Mick Aston, Phil Harding and Helen Geake discuss and defend their favourites.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The First Raid of the Vikings
programme.desc: Experts analyse the content of Viking burial sites to learn more about Norse culture, beginning with the mass grave of a raiding party, which dates back to Roman times.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson adjudicates a debate to decide the team's greatest discovery to date. With more than 250 digs to consider, many of which retrieved rare and valuable finds in addition to the ones that revealed intriguing archaeological fakery, Mick Aston, Phil Harding and Helen Geake discuss and defend their favourites.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The First Raid of the Vikings
programme.desc: Experts analyse the content of Viking burial sites to learn more about Norse culture, beginning with the mass grave of a raiding party, which dates back to Roman times.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A homeless man opens an abandoned suitcase in a park, only to find the body of a teenage girl inside. Jack and Nikki attend the scene with DS Sally Kirchner and are shocked to discover the victim's baby has been cut from her womb. From the placenta they are able to identify the father - but the married man in question denies any knowledge of the deceased. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star in the forensic crime drama, with guest appearances by Morven Christie and Sean Gallagher.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh finds an unlikely test subject for his revolutionary new artificial heart. Starring Rodger Corser, Nicole da Silva and Ryan Johnson.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.sub-title: I Don't Need Another Drink, Said Not Me Last Night
programme.desc: Hugh makes an emergency visit to the city to salvage his career. Starring Rodger Corser, Nicole da Silva and Ryan Johnson.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Evie's affair with the treasury minister hits the papers, while the shop is hit badly by the opening of Maison Gilles in London. Jack is attracted to the star of his latest film.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Marsha loses some of the nursery fund's money, and attracts suspicion when the other mothers notice her son has an expensive new bike.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Romance blossoms between Lieutenant Kate Butler and an officer from another unit. Meanwhile, Glory is not on the cards for Luke Roberts.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie receives good news, but Mubbs does not seem interested, and Diane struggles to cope as Joanna's life hangs in the balance - along with that of her unborn baby. Luckily, Owen is able to save the child - but it could be at the expense of the mother. Meanwhile, the driver responsible attempts to chat up Donna, but when she learns he is a drug dealer she goes behind Zubin's back to arrange his downfall.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Rob and Ken set out on the trail of warring factions the Hambilton Massive and Copthorne Crew, Kerry accepts a risky undercover assignment in a bid to help them nail local crime family the Radfords. Ramani returns to CSU and is appalled by the way Phil Hunter has handled things in her absence, while Rachel exacts a violent revenge on Martin Grainger, convinced he was responsible for telling Jack about her continuing involvement in the vice trade.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is horrified to discover her daughter Abi is involved with a local criminal whose activities are currently the focus of a Sun Hill investigation. Behind the scenes, Gina Gold offers June and Jim the chance of a lavish all-expenses-paid reception as they prepare for their impending wedding - while a beetle-browed Gabriel Kent glowers menacingly in the background.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde springs another surprise on Michelle.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle starts arranging a way to get Clyde out of the country - but there's some unfinished business to sort out first.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A woman suffers serious pelvic injuries after being struck by a motorbike, and finds herself unable to donate bone marrow to her unwell daughter as planned. A distraught young man takes his mother and Kate hostage claiming there is a conspiracy against him. Meanwhile, Jude catches Daniel taking antidepressants, and Ash and Laura's engagement announcement leads Rachel to realise she should accompany Mike to Somalia.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer incurs the wrath of the local golf club by declaring their prize trophy is a fake - and almost gets Lady Jane expelled into the bargain. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Chris Jury and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A penniless Indian arrives in Jersey claiming to be a faith healer who represents a powerful corporation. Celia Imrie and Art Malik guest star alongside regular John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie has her cards read to help find out where Freddie is, while the rest of the family check out a country mansion.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: After complaining about their long wait for lunch in the canteen, the staff are told to take over the kitchens themselves - but when they arrive for their shift, they find the area unhygienic. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden, John Inman and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel finishes his book and submits it to Alistair - who decides it needs a picture of the author on the cover. Unfortunately, choosing a suitable image proves troublesome. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. Bacchus suspects the dead girl's music teacher, since rumours persist that she was having an affair with him. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and her seasoned colleagues reopen the case of a political aide's murder when a dormant offshore bank account containing 40,000 is discovered in his name. Ben Ransley was killed in 1997 on the evening of Labour's landslide victory and in his wallet was a photo of a beautiful blonde. But neither his mother nor his best friend was able to identify the mystery woman. Is she the key to the crime? Drama, with former Brookside star John McArdle (Billy Corkhill), Jason Durr of Heartbeat fame and one-time Bad Girls actress Kika Mirylees joining Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters.

programme.title: The Brexit Election
programme.desc: Demot Murnaghan presents the latest General Election results, with analysis from leading politicians and experts including former Speaker of the House John Bercow.

programme.title: Election 2019 Live: The Results
programme.desc: As the polls close, Bernard Ponsonby anchors STV's live through-the-night coverage of the battle for Number 10, beginning with the results of a UK-wide exit poll. Correspondents report from the key Scottish seats as the shape of the new parliament unfolds, and viewers will also be brought important declarations and developments from other parts of the UK, with interviews and reaction from senior politicians and expert analysts.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring full analysis of the Election results so far, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Election 2019 Live
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham presents a special programme offering analysis of the Election results so far and a prediction of the likely shape of the Government.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Staffordshire County Showground plays host to David Dickinson and his dealers. A pair of horse prints have Karen Dalmeny in tears, Stewart Hofgartner goes 'pirate crazy' for a porthole, while Mark Stevens gets hot under the collar when some saucy films come into the den.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona is shaken by Graham's actions, Belle is annoyed that Ellis returned from Dubai and did not let her know he was back in the village, and Laurel is caught in the middle.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Robert has been living a double life for months now, but Friday 13th looks like being especially unlucky for the Weatherfield chef as evidence begins to pile up against him. Elsewhere, Tim springs a surprise proposal on Sally, and new parents Gemma and Chesney bring their babies home.

programme.title: The X Factor: The Band
programme.desc: The third in this new four-part talent show in which Simon Cowell searches for the next big singing group, hoping he can find a band to follow in the footsteps of previous X Factor success stories as One Direction, Fifth Harmony and Little Mix. Groups discovered on The X Factor have sold more than 400 million records.The winner of this show will be signed to Cowell's record label - but will they prove just as successful as their X Factor predecessors?.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the annual entertainment extravaganza from the London Palladium, attended this year by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. This year's show features music from Robbie Williams, Jamie Cullum, Emeli Sande, Lewis Capaldi, the Kanneh Masons and Mabel, as well as this year's Britain's Got Talent winner, Colin Thackery, and comedy from Frank Skinner, Kerry Godliman and Flo & Joan. There are also appearances from the casts of West End shows Groan Ups, Mary Poppins and Come from Away, and dance spectacle from Zurcaroh and Cirque du Soleil.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The supply of quality steaks to New York City, the making of surround-sound home cinema systems and the production and testing of tennis balls.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores an AC Ace for a man who has bought it as a surprise for his father.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: After chasing one for 38 years, Wayne Carini finally acquired a Hudson Italia from a woman called Hazel, who might have more surprises in store for the enthusiast.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle without brakes crashes into a crowd, and nine gallons of chemicals suddenly burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Two cranes collapse at a construction site, there is a spectacular crash on a notorious ski run and a firework explosion shatters windows. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Despite getting bogged down in the notorious 421 tract, the team tries to haul an ambitious 75 loads in just one week.

programme.title: Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Action from day four at Emirates Arena in Glasgow.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the armed robbery of a Seattle bank, in which one of the gunmen was killed by police fire and the other escaped after assaulting a family.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technicians McHugh and Meadows rush to the aid of two badly injured dogs. Plus, an exotic turtle proves a reluctant patient.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot choose between two dresses she thinks are perfect - while another customer has tried on 50 gowns and thinks none of them are right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kelly looks for a red dress for her wedding, while Beth decides to avoid traditional white gowns in favour of something black.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Magan wants a gown with colour, but her unique choice has her family seeing red. Bride Monica is looking for a princess dress to honour her late mother's wishes.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown nurtures a fragile baby kangaroo and confronts a Chihuahua with a mean streak.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Roxy gives birth to a litter of stillborn puppies after a difficult pregnancy. Plus, Chris Brown meets the prison inmates training service dogs, and panics his own dog in the surf.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A massive dog fighting operation leads the Pennsylvania SPCA's Humane Law Enforcement team to exhume the front yard of a property.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The team closes down a cat shelter to save the lives of the surviving occupants after finding some already dead.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades hope to make a profit from four items of tip-bound trash saved from the homes of chefs Tony Singh and Aldo Zilli.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, after the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, DNA was traced to the bomber through the saliva that remained on the back of a mailing label.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Brian Williams (aka basketball star Bison Dele) and his girlfriend Serena Karlan, who vanished with their skipper Bertrand Saldo while sailing in the South Pacific in July 2002. Their catamaran was discovered tied up and abandoned at a port in Tahiti. Investigatiors focused their attentions on the only person likely to have information - the missing man's elder brother who had also been on the boat and believed to have moored it.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of John Glasgow, an Arkansas chief financial officer whose car was found abandoned in a state park a day after he left his Little Rock home for work in 2008. It was later claimed he had been killed by disreputable creditors, but this has never been proved.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride's dream dress is on the line when her mother's budget is challenged, while another customer is an only child and used to getting what she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Robin and Flo make a major faux pas by having two sisters model their wedding dresses for their family side by side.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Sasha is looking for a pink dress to honour her mother's battle with breast cancer, while Penny receives some tough love from her family to help her stand tall.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Holly wants to look like a princess, but her mother and grandma have other ideas, while Lauren has yet to lay eyes on her custom-made ballgown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Bridesmaids are told they just need to show up to their fitting, but when the bride is unable to decide on a colour her party begin to get fed up.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A tantrum erupts after a bride overlooks her daughter for her future stepdaughter, making the salon begin to feel like a nursery school.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Plus-size opera singer Amanda comes to the store to find a diva dress, while bride Karalee realises that she is not comfortable with the dress she has bought.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Morgan describes her mother as the 'most opinionated', and hopes to get her final approval. Plus, Jennifer is heartbroken at her fitting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lincolnshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 16th-century Elizabethan mansion and hits the jackpot at a brewery.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne finds items to revamp at Woking Recycling Centre, enlisting Norman Wilkinson to create high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A 23-year-old man who overeats to cope with memories of his traumatic childhood loses his support network, and must find a new way to regain control of his life.

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.sub-title: The Murder of PC Ian Broadhurst
programme.desc: How the stopping of a suspected stolen car in December 2003 by West Yorkshire Police resulted in the murder of PC Ian Broadhurst by fugitive David Bieber, who was on the run from Florida law enforcement. Bieber had stolen the identity of a dead child in his native United States before fleeing to the UK.

programme.title: The Coroner: I Speak for the Dead
programme.desc: Barbara Gooding's life was torn apart when her son dies in her arms and it fell to Coroner Graham Hetrick to read his bullet wounds to uncover who shot the teenager.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Katie's house, relationships and financial situation are in tatters. Feeling down and out, she recruits the help of an unlikely duo in her exes, Kris and Kieran.
